TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EventLogSession extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Used to access the Event Log service on the local computer or a remote computer so you can manage and gather information about the event logs and event providers on the computer.

remarks.format: ## Examples For example code using this class, see [How To: Query for Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/5231a436-4cf2-4539-90d2-a04813aba069), [How to: Retrieve Information About an Event Publisher](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/2a3e897f-25a9-4dad-8541-171ac49970a3) or [How to: Configure and Read Event Log Properties](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/2d2b00b3-2d1d-4567-a47e-3f5a7c1955ac).

MemberSignature.Value: public EventLogSession ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new object, establishes a connection with the local Event Log service.

MemberSignature.Value: public EventLogSession (string server);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string server) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the computer on which to connect to the Event Log service.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new object, and establishes a connection with the Event Log service on the specified computer. The credentials (user name and password) of the user who calls the method is used for the credentials to access the remote computer.

MemberSignature.Value: public EventLogSession (string server, string domain, string user, System.Security.SecureString password, System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.SessionAuthentication logOnType);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string server, string domain, string user, class System.Security.SecureString password, valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.SessionAuthentication logOnType) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the computer on which to connect to the Event Log service.
The domain of the specified user.
The user name used to connect to the remote computer.
The password used to connect to the remote computer.
The type of connection to use for the connection to the remote computer.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new object, and establishes a connection with the Event Log service on the specified computer. The specified credentials (user name and password) are used for the credentials to access the remote computer.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CancelCurrentOperations ();
.method public hidebysig instance void CancelCurrentOperations() cil managed

Docs.summary: Cancels any operations (such as reading an event log or subscribing to an event log) that are currently active for the Event Log service that this session object is connected to.
Clears events from the specified event log.

remarks.format: ## Examples For example code using this class, see [How To: Export, Archive, and Clear Event Logs](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/7753ff87-f402-41ac-ac64-767e04dd1773).

MemberSignature.Value: public void ClearLog (string logName);
.method public hidebysig instance void ClearLog(string logName) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event log to clear all the events from.
Docs.summary: Clears events from the specified event log.

remarks.format: ## Examples For example code using this class, see [How To: Export, Archive, and Clear Event Logs](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/7753ff87-f402-41ac-ac64-767e04dd1773).

MemberSignature.Value: public void ClearLog (string logName, string backupPath);
.method public hidebysig instance void ClearLog(string logName, string backupPath) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event log to clear all the events from.
The path to the file in which the cleared events will be saved. The file should end in .evtx.
Docs.summary: Clears events from the specified event log, and saves the cleared events to the specified file.

remarks.format: ## Examples For example code using this class, see [How To: Export, Archive, and Clear Event Logs](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/7753ff87-f402-41ac-ac64-767e04dd1773).

MemberSignature.Value: public void Dispose ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases all the resources used by this object.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void Dispose (bool disposing);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by this object, and optionally releases the managed resources.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ExportLog (string path, System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType, string query, string targetFilePath);
.method public hidebysig instance void ExportLog(string path, valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType, string query, string targetFilePath) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event log to export events from, or the path to the event log file to export events from.
Specifies whether the string used in the path parameter specifies the name of an event log, or the path to an event log file.
The query used to select the events to export. Only the events returned from the query will be exported.
The path to the log file (ends in .evtx) in which the exported events will be stored after this method is executed.
Docs.summary: Exports events into an external log file. The events are stored without the event messages.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ExportLog (string path, System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType, string query, string targetFilePath, bool tolerateQueryErrors);

.method public hidebysig instance void ExportLog(string path, valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType, string query, string targetFilePath, bool tolerateQueryErrors) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event log to export events from, or the path to the event log file to export events from.
Specifies whether the string used in the path parameter specifies the name of an event log, or the path to an event log file.
The query used to select the events to export. Only the events returned from the query will be exported.
The path to the log file (ends in .evtx) in which the exported events will be stored after this method is executed.

indicates that the method will continue exporting events even if the specified query fails for some logs, and indicates that this method will not continue to export events when the specified query fails.
Docs.summary: Exports events into an external log file. A flag can be set to indicate that the method will continue exporting events even if the specified query fails for some logs. The events are stored without the event messages.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ExportLogAndMessages (string path, System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType, string query, string targetFilePath);
.method public hidebysig instance void ExportLogAndMessages(string path, valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType, string query, string targetFilePath) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event log to export events from, or the path to the event log file to export events from.
Specifies whether the string used in the path parameter specifies the name of an event log, or the path to an event log file.
The query used to select the events to export. Only the events returned from the query will be exported.
The path to the log file (ends in .evtx) in which the exported events will be stored after this method is executed.
Docs.summary: Exports events and their messages into an external log file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The event messages are exported in the default language.
## Examples For example code using this class, see [How to: Export, Archive, and Clear Event Logs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb671203.aspx).

MemberSignature.Value: public void ExportLogAndMessages (string path, System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType, string query, string targetFilePath, bool tolerateQueryErrors, System.Globalization.CultureInfo targetCultureInfo);

.method public hidebysig instance void ExportLogAndMessages(string path, valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType, string query, string targetFilePath, bool tolerateQueryErrors, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo targetCultureInfo) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event log to export events from, or the path to the event log file to export events from.
Specifies whether the string used in the path parameter specifies the name of an event log, or the path to an event log file.
The query used to select the events to export. Only the events returned from the query will be exported.
The path to the log file (ends in .evtx) in which the exported events will be stored after this method is executed.

indicates that the method will continue exporting events even if the specified query fails for some logs, and indicates that this method will not continue to export events when the specified query fails.
The culture that specifies which language that the exported event messages will be in.
Docs.summary: Exports events and their messages into an external log file. A flag can be set to indicate that the method will continue exporting events even if the specified query fails for some logs. The event messages are exported in the specified language.

remarks.format: ## Examples For example code using this class, see [How to: Export, Archive, and Clear Event Logs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bb671203.aspx).

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogInformation GetLogInformation (string logName, System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogInformation GetLogInformation(string logName, valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.PathType pathType) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the event log to get information about, or the path to the event log file to get information about.
Specifies whether the string used in the path parameter specifies the name of an event log, or the path to an event log file.
Docs.summary: Gets an object that contains runtime information for the specified event log.
Docs.returns: Returns an object that contains information about the specified log.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> GetLogNames ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> GetLogNames() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerable collection of all the event log names that are registered with the Event Log service.
Docs.returns: Returns an enumerable collection of strings that contain the event log names.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> GetProviderNames ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> GetProviderNames() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerable collection of all the event provider names that are registered with the Event Log service. An event provider is an application that publishes events to an event log.
Docs.returns: Returns an enumerable collection of strings that contain the event provider names.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogSession GlobalSession { get; }
.property class System.Diagnostics.Eventing.Reader.EventLogSession GlobalSession

Docs.summary: Gets a static predefined session object that is connected to the Event Log service on the local computer.
Docs.value: Returns an object that is a predefined session object that is connected to the Event Log service on the local computer.
